definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Two thirds of the students in our class are League members.
sentences.chinese: 我們班上三分之二的學生是共青團員。

sentences.english: He swims faster than any other student in his class(does).
sentences.chinese: 他比班上其他任何人都遊得快。

sentences.english: You really think Jennifer is the prettiest girl in our class?
sentences.chinese: 你真的認爲詹尼弗是我們班上最漂亮的女生？

sentences.english: Our class has more girlstudents than boystudents, so we must redress the balance.
sentences.chinese: 我們班上女生比男生多，所以我們得平衡一下。

sentences.english: She has remained ahead in the class for two years.
sentences.chinese: 她在班上名列前茅已兩年了。

sentences.english: Everyone of us is active in technical innovation.
sentences.chinese: 劉娜是班上最活躍的女孩。

sentences.english: There are fifty-three students in our cla .
sentences.chinese: 我們班上有五十三名學生。

sentences.english: This is kimchi. My Korean classmate made it. Wanna try some?
sentences.chinese: 這是我班上韓國同學做的泡菜。要不要喫喫看？

sentences.english: This is kimchi. My Korean classmate made it.
sentences.chinese: 這是我班上韓國同學做的泡菜。

sentences.english: When the teacher confronted Tommy with the facts, he admitted it.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲老師討厭班上愛嘻鬧的湯米。

sentences.english: There are several students in our class who are still not sure about the use of attributive classes.
sentences.chinese: 我們班上還有好多學生對定語從句的用法仍沒有把握。

sentences.english: who is the laziest person in your class?
Lily. Her English is the best in the class.
sentences.chinese: 我看是李莉，她的英語在班上是最好的。

sentences.english: For instance, there we had two women, who were athletic team captains.
sentences.chinese: 比如說班上有兩名女生，是學校運動隊隊長。

sentences.english: Li Ping is the best student in his class.
sentences.chinese: 李平在他的班上是最好的學生。

sentences.english: After two classes, I started to recognize several of the faces in each class.
sentences.chinese: 兩節課下來，每個班上我都已經認得好幾張面孔了。

definition: teacher in charge of a class
to study at the same school/fellow student/classmate/CL:位[wei4],個|个[ge4]
to be in the same class/to be in the same squad/classmate
the prettiest girl in the class
(Tw) teacher in charge of a class/homeroom teacher
the most handsome boy in the class
to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
to divide people into groups, teams, squads etc
